A bit longer than Epoisode 1 at 8 hours and with somewhat upgraded visuals, Episode 2 includes several memorable moments, locations and set pieces. The gameplay is familiar (with a couple of new enemy types) and the story (which picks up where Episode 1 ended) is a great intro into the epic and crucial sequel that we never got.
Man what a cliffhanger valve made for such amazing franchise.. RIP Alyx's dad.

An incredible game that is tied with the original Half-Life as my favorite entry in the official lineup. Episode 2 has an unmatched atmosphere on all fronts - the setting is immersive and beautiful, each act of the game flows together perfectly, and of course, the soundtrack is incredible. Seriously - while there may not be many songs in Episode 2, there is not a single one that isn't perfect for its situation.
Many improvements have also been made in general. Some are quality of life, such as the flashlight finally being separated from sprint and swim power, and the gunplay being more satisfying due to the interesting firefights you are thrown into. Hunters in general are just one of my favorite FPS enemies of all time.
